translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The forward and reverse order of conditions, the Tipitaka commentary on the Paṭṭhāna,

original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (5)🔽17.13. Kusalattika, Hīnattika🔽Akusalaṁ hīnaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nahīno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Abyākataṁ majjhimaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā naabyākato namajjhimo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe cha …pe… āsevane pañca …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya  kusala attika hīna attika  akusalam hīnam dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na hīnaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  abyākatam majjhimam dhammam paccayā na abyākataḥ na majjhimaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha ārammaṇe cha pe āsevane pañca pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: The section on the wholesome triad, the section on the inferior🔽With an unwholesome, inferior state as condition, there is an unwholesome, inferior state as effect. (Abbreviated.) In the section on cause there are three triplets and three duals. In the section on predominance there are three triplets and three duals. … In the section on non-obstruction there are three triplets and three duals.🔽With an indeterminate, middling state as condition, there is an indeterminate, middling state as effect. (Abbreviated.) In the section on cause there are six triplets and six duals. In the section on object there are six triplets and six duals. … In the section on prenascence there are five triplets and five duals. … In the section on nutriment there are three triplets and three duals. … In the section on faculty there are three triplets and three duals. … In the section on path there are three triplets and three duals. … In the section on association there are six triplets and six duals. … In the section on dissociation there are six triplets and six duals. … In the section on absence there are six triplets and six duals. … In the section on presence there are six triplets and six duals. … In the section on non-disappearance there are six triplets and six duals. … In the section on non-obstruction there are six triplets and six duals.

original: Kusalaṁ paṇītaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo napaṇīto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: kusalam paṇītam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na paṇītaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: With a wholesome, superior state as condition, there is a wholesome, superior state as effect. (Abbreviated.) In the section on cause there are six triplets and six duals. In the section on predominance there are six triplets and six duals. … In the section on nutriment there are three triplets and three duals. … In the section on path there are three triplets and three duals. … In the section on association there are six triplets and six duals. … In the section on dissociation there are six triplets and six duals. … In the section on absence there are six triplets and six duals. … In the section on presence there are six triplets and six duals. … In the section on non-disappearance there are six triplets and six duals. … In the section on non-obstruction there are six triplets and six duals.
